panels.description: Count of brokers available (online).
panels.title: Kafka: Online Brokers

panels.description:
Active Controller broker.
            It should always be 1. If the value is different than 1, then it must be alerted for troubleshooting.
panels.title: Kafka: Active Controller

panels.description:
Number of partitions where the preferred replica is not the leader.
            Usually, this number is 0.
            Restarting nodes could cause this values to change, but when reassigning happens the value stabilize.
panels.title: Kafka: Sum of Preferred Replica Imbalance

panels.description: Number of topics in the cluster.
panels.title: Kafka: Sum of Topics

panels.description:
Sum of requests per second rated over a 5 min. period.
            Gives an idea of the processing load in the cluster.
panels.title: Kafka: Rate of Requests/Sec

panels.description:
Sum of log sizes per broker.
            This must be compared with the total storage space available in the brokers.
panels.title: Kafka: Log Size

panels.description: Sum of Topic partitions across the cluster.
panels.title: Kafka: Sum of Partitions

panels.description:
Sum of Under-Replicated Partitions. This is caused by broker or volumes unavailable, impacting replicas to be offline, and reducing the ISR set for those partitions.
            There are transient scenarios that could lead to this number growing (e.g. broker restart), but if the number doesn't shrink in a short period of time (e.g. 1 minute), then it's recommended to alert.
panels.title: Kafka: Sum of Under-Replicated Partitions (URP)

panels.description:
Number of partitions where the number of replicas offline is higher than the minimum ISR configuration.
            This means partitions are not available for Producers with acks=all.
            We recommend alerting when this values is higher than 0.
panels.title: Kafka: Sum of Under-MinISR Partitions

panels.description:
Number of partitions where all replicas are offline.
            Producers and Consumers are affected by this condition.
            We recommend alerting when this values is higher than 0.
panels.title: Kafka: Sum of Offline Partitions

panels.description:
Sum of bytes in per second rated over a 5 min. period.
            Gives an idea of the incoming throughput handle by the cluster.
panels.title: Kafka: Bytes In/Sec

panels.description:
Sum of bytes out per second rated over a 5 min. period.
            Gives an idea of the outgoing throughput handle by the cluster.
panels.title: Kafka: Bytes Out/Sec

panels.description:
Rate of CPU seconds used by the Java process.
            100% usage represents one core. 
            If there are multiple cores, the total capacity should be 100% * number_cores.
panels.title: CPU usage

panels.description: Sum of JVM memory used, without including areas (e.g. heap size).
panels.title: Memory usage

panels.description: Sum of seconds used by Garbage Collection.
panels.title: GC collection

panels.description: Number of messages into topics per second, aggregated by sum without topic.
panels.title: Messages In/Sec

panels.description: Number of bytes into topics per second, aggregated by sum without topic.
panels.title: Bytes In/Sec

panels.description: Number of bytes out of topics per second, aggregated by sum without topic.
panels.title: Bytes Out/Sec

panels.description:
Percent of time the network thread pool is used.
            It should be below 60% or the capacity of threads should be tuned or 
            the cluster scaled to cope with the load.
panels.title: Network processor usage

panels.description:
Percent of time the IO thread pool is used.
            It should be below 60% or the capacity of threads should be tuned or 
            the cluster scaled to cope with the load.
panels.title: Request processor (IO) usage

panels.description:
Requests per second rated over a 5 minutes period.
            Includes API call and version.
panels.title: Requests rates

panels.description:
Request Errors per second rated over a 5 minutes period.
            Includes API call and version.
panels.title: Error rates

panels.description: Sum of connections count across cluster by brokers
panels.title: Sum of Connections alive per Broker

panels.description: Sum of rate of connections created across cluster by brokers
panels.title: Sum of Connections creation rate per Broker

panels.description: Sum of rate of connections closed across cluster by brokers
panels.title: Sum of Connections close rate per Broker

panels.description: Sum of connections count across cluster by listeners
panels.title: Sum of Connections alive per Listener

panels.description: Sum of rate of connections created across cluster by listener
panels.title: Sum of Connections creation rate per Listener

panels.description: Sum of rate of connections closed across cluster by listener
panels.title: Sum of Connections close rate per Listener

panels.description:
Rate of ISR shrinks per second.
            If this value is continuously higher than 0, then troubleshoot cause of ISR changing constantly.
panels.title: Rate of ISR Shrinks/sec

panels.description:
Rate of ISR expands per second.
            If this value is continuously higher than 0, then troubleshoot cause of ISR changing constantly.
panels.title: Rate of ISR Expands/sec

panels.description:
Time expend on the request queue.
            Moved from network socket to request queue by Network threads.
panels.title: Produce: Request Queue Time

panels.description:
Time expend doing local IO.
            Moved from request queue to storage device operations by IO threads.
panels.title: Produce: Local Time

panels.description:
Time expend waiting for coordination with other brokers/internal condition.
            At purgatory.
panels.title: Produce: Remote Time

panels.description:
Time expend waiting in response queue.
            Moved from purgatory to response queue by IO threads.
panels.title: Produce: Response Queue Time

panels.description:
Time expend delivering response.
            Moved from response queue to client by Networkc threads.
panels.title: Produce: Response Send Time

panels.description:
Time expend on the request queue.
            Moved from network socket to request queue by Network threads.
panels.title: Fetch: Request Queue Time

panels.description:
Time expend doing local IO.
            Moved from request queue to storage device operations by IO threads.
panels.title: Fetch: Local Time

panels.description:
Time expend waiting for coordination with other brokers/internal condition.
            At purgatory.
panels.title: Fetch: Remote Time

panels.description:
Time expend waiting in response queue.
            Moved from purgatory to response queue by IO threads.
panels.title: Fetch: Response Queue Time

panels.description:
Time expend delivering response.
            Moved from response queue to client by Networkc threads.
panels.title: Fetch: Response Send Time

panels.description:
Time expend on the request queue.
            Moved from network socket to request queue by Network threads.
panels.title: Fetch: Request Queue Time

panels.description:
Time expend doing local IO.
            Moved from request queue to storage device operations by IO threads.
panels.title: Fetch: Local Time

panels.description:
Time expend waiting for coordination with other brokers/internal condition.
            At purgatory.
panels.title: Fetch: Remote Time

panels.description:
Time expend waiting in response queue.
            Moved from purgatory to response queue by IO threads.
panels.title: Fetch: Response Queue Time

panels.description:
Time expend delivering response.
            Moved from response queue to client by Networkc threads.
panels.title: Fetch: Response Send Time

panels.description: Number of groups managed by Broker
panels.title: Number of Groups per Broker

panels.description: Number of stable groups managed by Broker
panels.title: Number of Groups per Broker per Status

panels.description:
Sum of produce message conversions per second.
            This value increases when the broker receives produce messages from clients using older versions.
panels.title: Sum of Produce conversion rate per sec

panels.description:
Sum of fetch message conversions per second.
            This value increases when the broker receives fetch messages from clients using older versions.
panels.title: Sum of Fetch conversion rate per sec

panels.description: Sum of connections aggregated by client version and name.
panels.title: Sum of Connections per version
